io.atomix

Class AtomixReplica.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.catalyst.util.Builder<Atomix>
      • io.atomix.Atomix.Builder
        • io.atomix.AtomixReplica.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    AtomixReplica

    public static class AtomixReplica.Builder
extends Atomix.Builder
    Builds an AtomixReplica.

    The replica builder configures an AtomixReplica to listen for connections from clients and other servers/replica, connect to other servers in a cluster, and manage a replicated log. To create a replica builder, use the AtomixReplica.builder(Address, Address...) method: 

       
   Atomix replica = AtomixReplica.builder(address, members)
     .withTransport(new NettyTransport())
     .withStorage(Storage.builder()
       .withDirectory("logs")
       .withStorageLevel(StorageLevel.MAPPED)
       .build())
     .build();
    The two most essential components of the builder are the Transport and Storage. The transport provides the mechanism for the replica to communicate with clients and other replicas in the cluster. All servers, clients, and replicas must implement the same Transport type. The Storage module configures how the replica manages the replicated log. Logs can be written to disk or held in memory or memory-mapped files.

    • Method Detail

      • withTransport

        public AtomixReplica.Builder withTransport(Transport transport)
        Sets the replica transport, returning the replica builder for method chaining.

        The configured transport should be the same transport as all other nodes in the cluster. If no transport is explicitly provided, the instance will default to the NettyTransport if available on the classpath.

        Overrides:
        withTransport in class Atomix.Builder
        Parameters:
        transport - The replica transport.
        Returns:
        The replica builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if transport is null

      • withClientTransport

        public AtomixReplica.Builder withClientTransport(Transport transport)
        Sets the client transport, returning the server builder for method chaining.

        The configured transport should be the same transport as all clients. If no transport is explicitly provided, the instance will default to the NettyTransport if available on the classpath.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The server builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if transport is null

        The serializer will be used to serialize and deserialize operations that are sent over the wire.

      • withStorage

        public AtomixReplica.Builder withStorage(Storage storage)
        Sets the replica storage module, returning the replica builder for method chaining.

        The storage module is the interface the replica will use to store the persistent replicated log. For simple configurations, users can simply construct a Storage object: 

           
   Atomix replica = AtomixReplica.builder(address, members)
     .withStorage(new Storage("logs"))
     .build();
        For more complex storage configurations, use the Storage.Builder: 
           
   Atomix replica = AtomixReplica.builder(address, members)
     .withStorage(Storage.builder()
       .withDirectory("logs")
       .withStorageLevel(StorageLevel.MAPPED)
       .withCompactionThreads(2)
       .build())
     .build();
        Parameters:
        storage - The replica storage module.
        Returns:
        The replica builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if storage is null

      • withElectionTimeout

        public AtomixReplica.Builder withElectionTimeout(Duration electionTimeout)
        Sets the replica election timeout, returning the replica builder for method chaining.

        The election timeout is the duration since last contact with the cluster leader after which the replica should start a new election. The election timeout should always be significantly larger than withHeartbeatInterval(Duration) in order to prevent unnecessary elections.

        Parameters:
        electionTimeout - The replica election timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The replica builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if electionTimeout is null

      • withHeartbeatInterval

        public AtomixReplica.Builder withHeartbeatInterval(Duration heartbeatInterval)
        Sets the replica heartbeat interval, returning the replica builder for method chaining.

        The heartbeat interval is the interval at which the replica, if elected leader, should contact other replicas within the cluster to maintain its leadership. The heartbeat interval should always be some fraction of withElectionTimeout(Duration).

        Parameters:
        heartbeatInterval - The replica heartbeat interval in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The replica builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if heartbeatInterval is null

      • withSessionTimeout

        public AtomixReplica.Builder withSessionTimeout(Duration sessionTimeout)
        Sets the replica session timeout, returning the replica builder for method chaining.

        The session timeout is assigned by the replica to a client which opens a new session. The session timeout dictates the interval at which the client must send keep-alive requests to the cluster to maintain its session. If a client fails to communicate with the cluster for larger than the configured session timeout, its session may be expired.

        Parameters:
        sessionTimeout - The replica session timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The replica builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if sessionTimeout is null

      • build

        public AtomixReplica build()
        Builds the replica.

        If no Transport was configured for the replica, the builder will attempt to create a NettyTransport instance. If io.atomix.catalyst.transport.NettyTransport is not available on the classpath, a ConfigurationException will be thrown.

        Once the replica is built, it is not yet connected to the cluster. To connect the replica to the cluster, call the asynchronous Atomix.open() method.

        Specified by:
        build in class Builder<Atomix>
        Returns:
        The built replica.
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if the replica is misconfigured
